Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(2) Summary

How much can you separate what you are building from how you are building it? This becomes an increasingly relevant question with IT moving from building systems to cultivating ecosystems. At the enterprise architecture level, one of the challenges nowadays is to decide which constraints to put in place to get a robust and evolvable landscape of interacting components, while at the same time it is important to minimize these constraints so that teams and units have some autonomy, and that the overall architecture can evolve continuously. In this presentation, we look at this interesting challenge from the standpoint of APIs, and how they can help to reduce the constraints to the necessary ones, while still resulting in an effective architecture.

The Need for Speed Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(9) Digital Landscapes Grow and Evolve

  1. All existing capabilities must be exposed digitally
    • Capabilities not exposed as APIs have no utility in the API landscape
  2. New capabilities are always conceived and built as APIs
    • API First puts the focus on digital capabilities
  3. Business models increasingly embrace exploratory and incremental approaches
    • Value chains are constantly tweaked
    • Business are changing from linear to Platform Business Models [Platform Business Models (1)]

(12) Decentralized Ecosystems



From Systems to Ecosystems Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(13) Optimizing for Resilience and Change

  • Integrated Systems are not going anywhere anytime soon
    • Integration allows optimizations that outperform more loosely coupled solutions
    • Integration can also be the result of Conway's Law [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_law] in action
  • Today's need for speed [The Need for Speed (1)] requires us to better separate architectural layers
    • Components/Capabilities are designed and implemented as usual
    • Composing these components is fundamentally different from building them
  • APIs are connective tissue and implementation encapsulation for components
    • Everything that is being built must be self-contained and have an API (microservices)
    • Everything that is being used must be used through its API (API first)


From Systems to Ecosystems Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(14) Programming in the Small/Large

  • Programming in the small still asks us to develop focused components
    • Agile as a way to develop iteratively and integrate feedback
    • DevOps as a way to move from finishing projects to managing products
    • TDD as a way to be more disciplined about component acceptance criteria
  • Programming in the large is asking us to embed ourselves in the API economy
    • Boundaries between organizations become fuzzy/dynamic/tactical
    • Lack of speed as a risk factor is growing steadily
    • Engineering and technology are changing fast but can be decisive


From Systems to Ecosystems Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(15) APIs: Old Wine in New Bottles?

  • Network APIs have been around forever (a.k.a. protocols)
    • APIs have been part of computers since their very beginning (1940s)
    • Network APIs have been in use since two computers were connected (1950s)
  • Today's APIs are a Business Strategy and not a Technology
    • Decrease the time to create or change the way how IT executes business goals
    • Capitalize on the openness and flexibility of Platform Business Models [Platform Business Models (1)]


From Systems to Ecosystems Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(16) Platform Business Models

API Journey: Connecting the Dots Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(18) API Strategy

Why are APIs strategically important and what do we want to get out of them?
  • Business: Becoming better at using digital value chains and changing them
  • Technology: Disentagling monoliths and increasing velocity
  • Organization: Improving autonomy to reduce coordination overhead


API Journey: Connecting the Dots Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(19) API Program

How are the going to realize the value that we have outlined in the API Strategy [API Strategy (1)]?
  • Evangelizing the strategy throughout the organization
  • Empowering teams with support and infrastructure
  • Adjusting to changing needs by listening to feedback


API Journey: Connecting the Dots Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(20) API Platform

What are we establishing and continuously evolving as a result of our API Program [API Program (1)]?
  • Managing all capabilities that are part of the platform
  • Supporting teams with tooling and infrastructure
  • Exposing APIs for private/partner/public consumption


API Journey: Connecting the Dots Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(21) API Products

How does product management change when products are built on and for the API Platform [API Platform (1)]?
  • Implementing capabilities with the largest possible degree of autonomy
  • Exposing APIs as part of the platform


API Journey: Connecting the Dots Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(22) API Teams: Platform and Products

  • Platform Team executes the program [API Program (1)] and manages the platform [API Platform (1)]
    • API Guidelines establish guardrails for product teams
    • Identifying friction with growing/evolving the platform and removing it
  • Product Team builds a product based on and as part of the platform [API Platform (1)]
    • Find the balance between enough support and sufficient autonomy
    • Identifying friction with growing/evolving the platform and removing it

Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(24) API Guidelines

Provide as few guidelines as you can get away with.
  • Start from zero and build up based on team and organizational needs
    • Teams can benefit from guidance in particular when it is accompanied by tooling


Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(25) The Anatomy of a Good Guideline

  • Why does the guideline exist?
    • Rationale for creating the guideline
  • What can be done to address the described issue
    • At least one good solution for addressing the issue
  • How to implement the solution
    • At least one way to use the solution in practice
  • Testing that the guideline has been followed
    • Some tests can be automated but many will be by declaration or review


Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(26) API Guideline Example



Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(27) Good is better than Best

  • Solutions (What) are addressing design challenges
    • Have a model for accepting new solutions
  • Practices (How) are implementing a solution
    • Have a model for accepting new practices


Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(28) Good Guideline Management

  • Guidelines should be managed in a participatory way
    • Guidelines are for capturing and sharing experiences across API teams
    • Everybody can comment or contribute to the guidelines
    • Over time it may make sense to develop a more formal approval process
    • There may be editors but their role is to improve guideline quality
  • Tooling should reflect the nature as a living document
    • One-way tooling is a bad choice
    • Collaborative tooling is a good choice


Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(29) Evolving Guidance (Google's AIP [https://google.aip.dev/])



Never Stop Evolving Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(30) Embrace the Chaos

  • Stop building systems and start cultivating ecosystems
  • Things are only going to get faster and technologically diverse
  • Push decisions as close to product teams as responsibly possible
  • Architects have to move from grand visions to effective landscaping


Conclusions

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes

(32) Removing Constraints Creates Potential

  • For platform teams:
    • Constrain what you must, not what you can
    • Separate the what (constraint) from the how (rule)
    • Make guidelines participatory and a living document
  • For product teams:
    • Provide feedback about the utility of the provided platform
    • Be creative and provide feedback to the platform team
    • Participate in the community of practice in your organization


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): The Art of the Necessary:
Effective Management of API Landscapes
